intro: Curculigo brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stalked arrowhead plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its compact, rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces small, pale green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often resembling arrowheads in shape. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
